page.title: 12R.H.& D.Railway
page.content:
A major attraction along this part of the south coast is the{Romney Hythe {and Dymchurch Railway.}It is one of the longest private lines in the country and by far the longest miniature railway in the world. It was opened in July 1927 the brainchild of {Captain J.E.P. Howey,}the famous racing motorist and miniature railway enthusiast. He was the main driving force behind the railway up until his death in 1963.
The railway runs for 14 miles across {Romney Marsh}from Hythe to Dungeness. and is a 15 inch gauge with locomotives and carriages one third size.
